DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Outcome Measurement Safety Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:The result of an action.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard._The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true._Values of two-valued logic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
